item.title: Bash if statement with random number
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

RANGE = 5
number = $RANDOM
let "number %= $RANGE"
if [ "$number" = "2" ]; then
echo It's two!
else
echo Not two!
fi

Not to sure on this, I’ve never used random numbers in a bash script.
Take a look at this if my code doesn’t work out: http://tldp.org/LDP/abs/html/randomvar.html

Read full topic
item.source: Bash if statement with random number

item.title: Bash if statement with random number
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

well, I am basically thing to do this in BASH

$var1 = Random(1,5);
if($var1==“2”){
echo “its 2”;
}else{
echo “not 2”;
}

I tried to do something like that but I can’t get it…
var1="$RANDOM%5+1";if($var1 == 2) then echo “it is 2”;else echo “not 2”; fi

Read full topic
